IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: The Brown Alumni Association seeks to encourage alumni to participate actively in the Brown community, to attend events, to volunteer, to create new ways for alumni to stay connected to Brown and to contribute to the greatness of our University. Our vision is to involve the greatest possible number of alumni and alumnae with Brown on an annual basis by creating a range of programs and services so appealing that alumni will seek to remain engaged with the University and each other. Consistent with the core values of community, education and service, the BAA's programs and services should provide alumni with meaningful opportunities to: 1)Continue the process of life-long learning 2) foster diversity and community, strengthening ties to Brown and growing relationships with other alumni 3) receive valuable services to enhance their lives and careers 4) serve the University, other alumni, students and the community at large.
IRS990.MissionDescription: The Brown Alumni Association seeks to encourage alumni to participate actively in the Brown community, to attend events, to volunteer, to create new ways for alumni to stay connected to Brown and to contribute to the greatness of our University. Our vision is to involve the greatest possible number of alumni and alumnae with Brown on an annual basis by creating a range of programs and services so appealing that alumni will seek to remain engaged with the University and each other. Consistent with the core values of community, education and service, the BAA's programs and services should provide alumni with meaningful opportunities to: 1)Continue the process of life-long learning 2) foster diversity and community, strengthening ties to Brown and growing relationships with other alumni 3) receive valuable services to enhance their lives and careers 4) serve the University, other alumni, students and the community at large.
IRS990.Description: ALUMNI ENGAGEMENT EVENTS: SERVICES AND PROGRAMS SUCH AS ALUMNI WEEKENDS AND CLASS REUNIONS PROVIDED FOR BROWN UNIVERSITY GRADUATES AND VOLUNTEERS IN AN EFFORT TO FOSTER CONTINUED INVOLVEMENT AND SUPPORT FOR BROWN UNIVERSITY AND THE BROWN COMMUNITY.

Activity2.Description: CLUB PROGRAMS & OUTREACH: BROWN ALUMNI ASSOCIATION SUPPORTS OVER 90 WORLDWIDE SUBSIDIARY CHAPTERS WITH PROGRAMMING THAT KEEPS CLUB MEMBERS INVOLVED IN THE BROWN UNIVERSITY COMMUNIUTY. EVENT PROGRAMMING IS BOTH EDUCATIONAL AND SOCIAL IN NATURE, IS DESIGNED TO PROMOTE INTEREST IN BROWN UNIVERSITY, AND IS DELIVERED TO BOTH REGIONAL AND MULTICULTURAL ALUMNI CONSTITUENCIES.

Activity3.Description: ALUMNI SERVICES: SPECIFIC SERVICES PROVIDED BY AND FOR BROWN ALUMNI ON AN INDIVIDUAL BASIS, INCLUDING CAREER PROGRAMS, NETWORKING, MENTORING AND ALUMNI COLLEGE ADVISING. THESE PROGRAMS PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES FOR ALUMNI AND STUDENTS TO LEARN ABOUT AND SHARE CAREER-RELATED GOALS AND STRATEGIES. OTHER SERVICES INCLUDE AN ALUMNI INTERVIEWING PROGRAM FOR PROSPECTIVE STUDENTS.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: The Brown Alumni Association has a complete process and budget for grants to Clubs. For program assistance, Club officers must complete an offical request form with all details regarding type of event, number of people and cost. Grants are reviewed on a case by case basis. For annual grants, Clubs receive a certain amount of money per Club member to help offset administrative costs.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 6
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The organization is made up of members organized to further and to support the interests of Brown University.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The nominating commitee shall seek recommendations from the members of the Board of Governors of the Alumni Association, each Brown club or other regional organization, class officers, current and emeriti alumni and alumnae trustees, past Presidents of the Alumni Association, the Executive Committee of the Brown Alumni Schools Committees, chairpersons of the Brown Alumni Annual Fund, Brown Alumni Magazine Board members, and members of any standing committee of the Alumni Association and other University organizations and individuals as they deem advisable. From all the recommendations it receives, the Nominating Committee shall submit to the Board of Governors for its approval, a slate of final nominations. No individual may be nominated for more than one office. A petition signed by members of the Alumni Association is filed with the Secretary of the Alumni Association immediately before the election naming a candidate or candidates. The names of those candidates nominated by the Board of Governors, together with the candidates nominated by petition, shall be placed on a printed ballot and mailed to the membership of the Alumni Association who votes and elects the governing body.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: A copy of the form 990 is reviewed by the board of governors before filing.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The organization does not make its financial statments/governing documents/conflict of interest policy available to the general public. The financial statments and all other documents are available for members to view upon request, by appointment only, and within 24 hours of the request.

The organization has a funding committee which has direct oversight and responsibility for the selection of its outside CPA, as well as its annual financial statement audit. There was no change in this process from the prior year.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12C
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: While the Organization does not maintain a written conflict of interest policy, the Organization does handle any identified possible issues relating to conflict of interest informally and continue to monitor the relationships to ensure they continue to be appropriate for the Organization. This process is based on the process used by Brown University and applies to all staff based on their threshold of responsibility.
